Letter 47

Letters to Summer is a newsletter written by two best friends living on opposite sides of the country. Every other Thursday, we share the things we're reading, watching, listening to, and enjoying. We hope you like it.

On Fall

On one hand, I like fall a lot. I like the cooler temperatures and that feeling that hangs in the air that reminds me of being in school or going trick or treating as a kid. I like wearing big sweaters and thick socks. I like the corny Hallmark smell of autumn-themed candles. On the other hand, I hate that it‚Äôs already dark by 7 pm, and I hate that it‚Äôs going to keep getting dark earlier and earlier. I hate that it‚Äôs going to get harder to make outdoor plans as it gets colder when I‚Äôm already barely leaving my apartment. I hate that wearing a mask fogs up my glasses even worse when the temperature drops below 70 degrees. But there‚Äôs nothing I can do about any of that‚Äîfall is here! We are still in the middle of a pandemic and we are still learning how to cope! The best I can do is appreciate the coziness of having a warm drink inside, invest in a SAD lamp, and look forward to the fall Animal Crossing update, I guess. We‚Äôre in this together!!!

I‚Äôve been craving a seasonal coffee since September hit. Of course, I‚Äôm in California, so much of this month has been windows closed, air purifier on, N95 and surgical masks doubled up to take my laundry out to the washer. Although my area is lucky enough to have had less smokey days, the season still doesn‚Äôt feel real. I want to wear long sleeves and drink something artificially flavored!
